source.publisher: U.S. Department of Health & Human Services

contentBlocks.excerpt: Respect for persons incorporates at least two ethical convictions: first, that individuals should be treated as autonomous agents, and second, that persons with diminished autonomy are entitled to protection.
contentBlocks.rationale: Establishes informed consent as a moral and ethical imperative, especially in research involving human subjects.
contentBlocks.notes: Forms the basis of modern consent requirements in U.S. health and research policy.
